title: Frits van Hall
text:
Frederik Jan (Frits) van Hall (8 May 1899 (Suikerfabriek Bodja near <a href="Semarang">Semarang</a>) – 18 January 1945 (<a href="Gliwice">Gliwice</a>)) was a Dutch sculptor executed for his role in the <a href="Dutch%20resistance">Dutch resistance</a> in 1945.
Frits was born near Semarang in the <a href="Dutch%20East%20Indies">Dutch East Indies</a>. His family returned to the Netherlands in 1905. His sister, the dancer <a href="Suzy%20van%20Hall">Suzy van Hall</a>, was born in 1907.
His work includes the <a href="Monument%20Indi%C3%AB-Nederland">Van Heutsz monument</a>, the Moerdijk monument and the decoration of the <a href="Enschede">Enschede</a> town hall.
